sen.j: 1951年、宇治田原自動車（後の京阪宇治交通。現在は京阪バスに合併し会社解散）は宇治より小倉、久御山町北部を経由して淀に至るバス路線の免許申請を行った。
sen.e: In 1951, there existed a bus service company, Ujitawara Jidosha (later Keihan Uji Kotsu,) which was later dissolved by a merger with Keihan Bus.

In 1951, Ujitawara Jidosha (later Keihan Uji Kotsu, which was later dissolved by a merger with Keihan Bus), filed an application for an operating license for bus services between Uji and Yodo via Ogura and Kumiyama-cho Hokubu (Northern Kumiyama Town).

sen.j: この理由は沿線住民の要望があったのと宇治地区と淀地区（当時は久世郡淀町）との往来が多いものの淀より宇治までのバス路線が存在していなかった事によるものである。
sen.e: This license application had been made in accordance with the request of residents living along the route between Yodo and Uji where there had been no bus service despite people's frequent intercommunications between Uji area and Yodo area (then Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun).

sen.j: しかし既に大正末期より上記の淀より大久保・新田までの路線を運行していた京阪バス（当時の京阪自動車）がこの新路線に強く反対した。
sen.e: However, the plan for this new bus service was strongly opposed by Keihan Bus (then Keihan Jidosha) which had already been operating the above mentioned bus line from Yodo to Okubo and Shinden since the end of Taisho Period.

However, the plan for this new bus service was strongly opposed by Keihan Bus (then Keihan Jidosha) which had already been operating the above mentioned bus line from Yodo to Okubo and Shinden since the end of the Taisho Period.

sen.j: 理由は京阪バスは過去に設定されていた伏見桃山駅～宇治駅 (京阪)の路線との連絡を目的として、この路線の宇治延長を計画し免許申請も行っていたが、宇治市中心部は宇治田原自動車のエリアと判断され免許が降りなかった事からである。
sen.e: The reason for Keihan's opposition was that its application for license for an extension line to connect with the existing line between Fushimi Momoyama Station and Uji Station (Keihan) was not permitted because the central part of Uji City was regarded as a business area of Uji Tawara Jidosha.

The reason for Keihan's opposition was that its application for license for an extended line to connect with the existing line between Fushimi Momoyama Station and Uji Station (Keihan) was not permitted because the central part of Uji City was regarded as a business area of Uji Tawara Jidosha.

The reason for Keihan's opposition was that its application for license for an extended line to connect with the existing line between Fushimi Momoyama Station and Uji Station (Keihan) was not permitted because the central part of Uji City was regarded as a business area of Uji Tawara Jidosha.

sen.j: またこの際に、宇治田原自動車の計画に対し「当社の大久保経由の路線を開設させない限り、（途中の経路が違うとは言え）宇治田原自動車の淀乗り入れには反対する」と京阪バス社内でも強く意見があった事もある。
sen.e: Also within Keihan Bus, there was a strong opposition against the plan of Uji Tawara Jidosha, saying "extension of Uji Tawara Jidosha's service into Yodo should not be allowed unless our (Keihan's) plan to open a new line from Yodo to Uji via Okubo is permitted (though each line takes different intermediate course.)

Also within Keihan Bus Company, there was strong opposition against the plan of Uji Tawara Jidosha, stating that the "extension of Uji Tawara Jidosha's service into Yodo should not be allowed unless our (Keihan's) plan to open a new line from Yodo to Uji via Okubo is permitted (though each line would use a different intermediate route.)

Also within Keihan Bus Company, there was strong opposition against the plan of Uji Tawara Jidosha, stating that the 'extension of Uji Tawara Jidosha's service into Yodo should not be allowed unless our (Keihan's) plan to open a new line from Yodo to Uji via Okubo is permitted (though each line would use a different intermediate route.)'

sen.j: これにより宇治田原自動車と京阪バス間で運輸協定を締結し、宇治田原自動車の宇治～小倉～淀間の路線の開設及び淀～大久保・新田間の路線の宇治延長を認める事に合意した。
sen.e: Then, a traffic agreement was made between Uji Tawara Jidosha and Keihan Bus that allowed for Uji Tawara Jidosha to open a bus route between Uji and Yodo via Ogura and for Keihan Bus to extend their line between Yodo and Okubo Shinden upto Uji.

sen.j: 締結後の1953年4月1日に宇治淀線（小倉経由）を開業した。
sen.e: After the agreement entered into, Uji-Yodo Route (via Ogura) was opened on April 1, 1953.

sen.j: もう一つは、宇治田原自動車エリア内の宇治駅 (JR西日本)前に京阪バスは国鉄宇治駅前案内所（現在廃止）を設けて定期乗車券発売や京都定期観光バスの旅客誘致を行った事である。
sen.e: Another was that Keihan Bus established an information booth in front of Uji Station (JR West) within the property of Uji Tawara Jidosha in order to sell commuter tickets and to entice travelers for Kyoto Regular Tour Bus.

sen.j: この為宇治田原自動車は1955年10月28日付けで陸運局に営業妨害行為として京阪バスを相手取り調停を申請した。
sen.e: Consequently, as of October, 28, 1955, Uji Tawara Jidosha applied to the Land Transport Bureau for mediation to discourage Keihan's obstructive activities against Uji Tawara's business.

sen.j: この当時は京阪バスは京阪バス淀営業所（現在廃止）、宇治田原自動車は京阪宇治バス宇治営業所の各営業所が担当していた。

sen.cmt: 「京阪宇治バス」のルーツは1922年設立の「宇治田原自動車商会」。同商会は後に「宇治田原自動車株式会社」に改組。戦後の1959年には京阪グループ入りし、その後紆余曲折を経て現在の「京阪宇治バス株式会社」となった。すなわち、1959年に「京阪宇治交通株式会社」に社名変更。1980年には旅行などのサービスを中心とする子会社「京阪宇治交サービス」を設立。この「京阪宇治交サービス」は1999年に親会社「京阪宇治交通株式会社」よりバスサービス部門の譲渡を受け、さらに2003年4月に「京阪宇治交サービス」の子会社として設立された「京阪宇治バス株式会社」にバス事業を譲渡した。
sen.e: At that time, these lines were under the control of both the Yodo Office of Keihan Bus Company (now defunct) and the Uji Office of Uji Tawara Jidosha (currenttly Keihan Uji Bus Co., Ltd.)

sen.e: During this time, around 1955, Uji Tawara Jidosha in competition with Keihan Bus had opened an information booth for bus services, combined with an office for taxi services, in front of JNR Uji Station, both of which were later abolished.

sen.j: 開業より1950年代から1960年代前半までは両路線共上記以外は停留所の改廃・改称（1963年10月1日に奈良電大久保を近鉄大久保、奈良電小倉を近鉄小倉に改称等）と便数の微増があった程度であった。
sen.e: From their inauguration upto 1950s and the first half of 1960s, the above two routes (via Ogura and via Okubo) marked a little increase in the number of their services beside the above mentioned, including reorganization and renaming of bus stops, such as Nara-den Okubo (Okubo Station of Nara Electric Railway) changed to Kintetsu Okubo (Okubo Station of Kintetsu Railway,) and Nara-den Ogura to Kintetsu Ogura.

sen.j: まず、系統番号 (バス)の設定（京阪バスは淀宇治線は11号経路（途中折返しは11A号経路）、山崎宇治線（1980年代初期頃に廃止）は12号経路。京阪宇治交通は大久保経由が21系統、小倉経由が31系統、淀～市田の区間運転系統が32系統となる）。
sen.e: Firstly, the numbering of routes and lines: Keihan Bus designated its Uji-Yodo Route as Route No. 11 (a looping- back service from midway point was designated as Route No. 11A) and its Yamazaki-Uji Route as Route No.12 (abolished in the early 1980s), and Keihan Uji Kotsu designated its Uji-Yodo Route via Okubo as Line No.21, the same route via Ogura as Line No.31 and its sectional services between Yodo and Ichida as Line No.32.

sen.j: 次に、市役所前（現・総合庁舎）～宇治橋西詰間の経路変更（1970年3月30日に宇治市の都市計画道路（若森線）の一部完成で小倉経由のみ同道路に、同道路の完全完成により1976年7月10日に大久保経由も含む全便が同都市計画道路に載替。
sen.e: Secondly, shifting of courses: On March 30, 1970, when Uji City's planning road (Wakamori Line) was partially completed, a course between Shiyaku-sho mae (current Sogo-chosha) and Uji-bashi Nishizume of the Uji-Yodo Route via Ogura was shifted to the new road, and on July 10, 1976, when the said road was completed, all services on the same section including the Uji-Yodo Route via Okubo were moved to the newly constructed City road.
